thread.title: Iraqi Forces Launch Major Push to Liberate Western Mosul From Daesh
thread.title_full: Iraqi Forces Launch Major Push to Liberate Western Mosul From Daesh

title: Iraqi Forces Launch Major Push to Liberate Western Mosul From Daesh
text:
Iraqi Forces Launch Major Push to Liberate Western Mosul From Daesh Â© Sputnik/ 0 54 2 0 Iraqi Prime Minister Haider Abadi announced on Sunday the start of the operation to liberate the western part of the city of Mosul from Daesh terrorists, the AFP reported. 
The western part of the city, which is Iraq's second largest, has been under the siege for two months, according to the report. 
Iraqi and US-led coalition forces liberated the eastern part of the city in late January 2017. 
Last October, Iraqi Prime Minister Haider Abadi announced the start of the military operation to retake Mosul from Daesh militants. Iraqi troops and their allies, including local Sunni militias and the US-led coalition against Daesh, are involved in the offensive. 
The US-led coalition of 68 nations is conducting airstrikes against Daesh in Syria and Iraq. 
Daesh is outlawed in the United States, Russia and numerous other countries. 
DETAILS TO FOLLOW
